intro: Clarkia gracilis subsp. sonomensis, commonly known as Sonoma Clarkia, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Clarkia gracilis subsp. sonomensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
